plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its beautiful and abundant pink to white flowers that create spectacular spring displays.
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms have significant cultural importance in Japan, symbolizing the transient nature of life.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A perennial bulbous plant producing bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers often seen in woodlands and meadows.
plants.funFact: Wild daffodils are often naturalized in woodland areas and are considered a sign of early spring.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An evergreen tree or shrub with cylindrical golden flower spikes that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round, peak in late winter to early spring
plants.funFact: Banksias evolved unique flower spikes that provide abundant nectar, supporting local ecosystems.

plants.name: Mimosa pudica
plants.description: A creeping annual or perennial herb known for its fern-like leaves that close when touched and bright pink spherical flowers.
plants.bloomingSeason: March to October in tropical regions
plants.location: South and Central America, widely cultivated in tropics
plants.funFact: Its rapid leaf folding is a defense mechanism to reduce damage from herbivores.
